glsa.title: libcdio: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in libcdio.

background.p: libcdio is a library for accessing CD-ROM and CD images.

description.p: Devon Miller reported a boundary error in the "print_iso9660_recurse()" function in files cd-info.c and iso-info.c when processing long filenames within Joliet images.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted ISO image in the cd-info and iso-info applications, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Applications linking against shared libraries of libcdio are not affected.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
